channel.title: I am making a server
channel.description: Ok when i run the server and the black box pops up and it sayingg that server is listing on port 0.0.0.0:43594 not my ip how do i change this to my ip. i have teamviewer if anyone can help me.

item.title: I am making a server
item.dc:creator: @Mee0345 Mee0345
item.description:
@Mee0345 wrote:

[quote=“heatrn11, post:10, topic:431835”][quote author=Mee0345 link=topic=534538.msg3908220#msg3908220 date=1328440676]
IS EVERYONE HERE RETARDED??? t
The 0.0.0.0 IP is local host… It’s the same as 127.0.0.1 , you give them your no-ip (Assuming you have one of course) then Uusers connect to that, a valid connection would relay if you have portforwarded the port 43594 correctly. And further help needed just add me on msn (brandonrsps@hotmail.com)
[/quote]
If you keep the source’s ip: 0.0.0.0, The client will still connect to your source, but only If you change the IP in the client to your no-ip -____-. And we all know that 0.0.0.0 Is local host, but it still connects if you just leave it like that in the source.

BTW you don’t have to open port 43594.[/quote]
If you want players to connect without getting errors on relay, then yeah you do.

Read full topic

item.title: I am making a server
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

[quote=“Mee0345, post:9, topic:431835”]IS EVERYONE HERE RETARDED??? t
The 0.0.0.0 IP is local host… It’s the same as 127.0.0.1 , you give them your no-ip (Assuming you have one of course) then users connect to that, a valid connection would relay if you have portforwarded the port 43594 correctly. And further help needed just add me on msn (brandonrsps@hotmail.com)[/quote]
If you keep the source’s ip: 0.0.0.0, The client will still connect to your source, but only If you change the IP in the client to your no-ip -____-. And we all know that 0.0.0.0 Is local host, but it still connects if you just leave it like that in the source.

BTW you don’t have to open port 43594.

Read full topic

IS EVERYONE HERE RETARDED??? t
The 0.0.0.0 IP is local host… It’s the same as 127.0.0.1 , you give them your no-ip (Assuming you have one of course) then users connect to that, a valid connection would relay if you have portforwarded the port 43594 correctly. And further help needed just add me on msn (brandonrsps@hotmail.com)

item.title: I am making a server
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

runescapeftw1234:

heart i keep the ip in the source but when i give my friends the client they cannot connect on this one.

no only change ip in client. Then compile the client (change source back to 0.0.0.0.) Also make sure you portforwarded.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

keep the ip at 0.0.0.0 in the source, but change in client…the black box is called CMD btw, and I suggest you work with delta before using PI.
